field_reports.description:
On the night of October 3rd and early morning of October 4th, 2024, regions of Bosnia and Herzegovina were struck by intense rainfall, severely impacting the municipalities of Jablanica, Konjic, Fojnica, Kiseljak, and Kreševo. The extreme weather triggered flash floods that surged with such force that they led to devastating landslides. In several locations, the landslides moved boulders weighing over 10 tons, crushing homes and damaging property.

 

The municipalities of Jablanica and Konjic experienced the most severe impact from the flash floods and landslides, while Kreševo, Fojnica, and Konjic suffered substantial damage from the flash floods. Many communities in these municipalites were cut off and isolated due to the destruction of road networks and communication infrastructure, further complicating emergency response efforts. The most extensive damage was reported in Donja Jablanica and Zlate, both located within the municipality of Jablanica, and in Buturović Polje in the municipality of Konjic.

 

By October 11th, 2024, 23 fatalities had been confirmed, with five individuals still officially reported as missing. The flood's impact on households across affected municipalities was also severe, with 163 households in Jablanica, 200 in Konjic, 100 in Kreševo, 170 in Fojnica, and 500 in Kiseljak affected by the disaster.

 

The situation remains critical in the municipalities of Jablanica and Konjic, where the removal of debris and boulders brought down by the landslides is still ongoing. The damage to infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and communication lines, is so extensive that full repairs are projected to take years. These infrastructural challenges, combined with the displacement of residents, necessitate urgent shelter solutions. Efforts are underway to establish container camps to house those who have lost their homes or cannot return to their residences due to unsafe conditions.

 

Meanwhile, in Kreševo, Fojnica, and Kiseljak, the focus remains on the immediate first response to the floods. Local efforts are directed toward addressing the basic needs of evacuees, mitigating health risks, and ensuring access to clean drinking water. Emergency response teams are working closely with local authorities to prevent potential outbreaks of waterborne diseases and to restore essential services. The coordinated efforts in these municipalities aim to stabilize the situation as quickly as possible, allowing communities to begin the recovery process.

results.summary:
On the night of October 4, 2024, a series of flash floods struck five municipalities in Bosnia and Herzegovina: Jablanica, Konjic, Kreševo, Fojnica, and Kiseljak. In addition to the severe flooding, the municipality of Jablanica was further impacted by an earthquake, compounding the devastation.

The combined effects of the flash floods and earthquake triggered a landslide in the Donja Jablanica region, completely destroying large parts of the area. As of October 4, 2024, more than 18 individuals have been confirmed dead, and over 12 people remain missing. This number is not final, as several communities remain isolated and cut off from rescue and communication efforts due to the destruction of critical infrastructure.

In the affected municipalities, schools have been canceled, and roads have been severely damaged, with many rendered completely impassable. In the Jablanica region, phone and internet connections are unavailable, further complicating coordination and rescue efforts.

The situation remains fluid as rescue operations continue, and updated information is expected as access to the cut-off areas improves.

field_reports.description:
A recent powerful storm has caused serios demages in the northern part of Bosnia and Herzegovina - municipality of Srbac, located in the Republic of Srpska. The storm has affected more than 100 households, with over 15 residential buildings suffering devastation of the roof. Inside these homes, many rooms have been severely affected by the storm's force.

The local elementary school faced a dire situation as the storm tore off its roof, leading to the urgent evacuation of the students. The floodwaters breached over 70 residential properties, causing extensive damage, while in 20 homes, the flood wave has decimated almost everything essential for the residents' daily activities. The agricultural sector also took a hit, with 7 chicken farms and 3 pig farms sustaining damage. The crops in the area have been severely impacted as well. The disruption in communication further exacerbates the challenges faced by the community.

The local branch of the Red Cross has focus it's activities on assesment of the needs of the affected population, ensuring that all actions in providing humanitarian resposne is in line with the real needs of the endangered. In response to the significant damages and the hardships endured by the local population, the municipality of Srbac has declared a state of natural disaster.

field_reports.description: The outbreak of measles in Bosnia and Herzegovina began at the beginning of 2024. Initially, in January and February 2024 the highest number of cases was recorded in Bijeljina, Banja Luka, and the Tuzla Canton, specifically in the cities of Tuzla and Živinice. Subsequently, the number increased in the Sarajevo Canton, especially in the mid March where it is still on the rise. Measles cases have also been reported in the Brčko District of BiH. In addition to measles, cases of pertussis (whooping cough) and varicella (chickenpox) are also being recorded. Due to the increased number of cases, a measles epidemic was declared in Bijeljina in February 2024, followed by one in Banja Luka. According to official data from the Institute of Public Health of Republika Srpska, as of March 22, 2024, there have been 30 cases of measles and 125 cases of pertussis reported. The highest number of pertussis cases was recorded in Banja Luka, totaling 105. In the Brčko District of BiH, 28 cases of measles have been reported. According to official data, the vaccination rate is only 52%. According to official data from the Institute of Public Health of the Federation of BiH, in the last three months, from January to March 2024, a total of 1,329 cases of measles have been reported, with the highest number in the Sarajevo Canton (875 cases) and the Tuzla Canton (396 cases). Comparing monthly data, a significant increase can be observed from 76 cases in January 2024 to 289 cases in February and 906 cases in March 2024. Due to the deteriorating epidemiological situation in the Tuzla Canton, the Ministry of Health of the Tuzla Canton, upon the proposal of the Institute of Public Health of the Tuzla Canton, issued an order declaring a measles epidemic in the Tuzla Canton on February 23, 2024. In addition to measles, 69 cases of pertussis were recorded in the Tuzla Canton from January to March 2024. By the end of the first week of April, a total of 1,007 cases of measles had been reported in the Sarajevo Canton, mainly among children aged 1 to 4 years (42.4%), followed by the age group of 5 to 9 years (29%) and the age group of 10 to 14 years (11%). There were also 65 cases of measles reported among individuals aged 30 to 65 years. Due to the increased number of reported cases, a measles epidemic was declared in the Sarajevo Canton on February 10, 2024. In addition to the measles outbreak, the Sarajevo Canton has also been burdened with a higher number of pertussis cases. The Ministry of Health of the Sarajevo Canton declared an epidemic of pertussis, also known as whooping cough, on March 12 for the territory of the canton. A total of 112 cases of pertussis were recorded in the Sarajevo Canton from January to March 2024. Cases of pertussis were also reported in the Zenica-Doboj Canton, specifically 88 cases from January to March 2024. Hospital visits are prohibited due to this situation. Additional complications due to chickenpox: During the period from January to March 2024, a higher number of chickenpox cases were recorded, totaling close to 1,500 cases, with the highest numbers in the Sarajevo Canton (357), the Tuzla Canton (308), the Una-Sana Canton (296), and Herzegovina (260). These data represent the situation for January and February 2024. Vaccination coverage rate According to health authorities, less than 60% of the population is vaccinated against measles and rubella. In 2022, Bosnia and Herzegovina achieved a vaccination rate of 60% with two doses of the measles vaccine, which is significantly below the prescribed level of the World Health Organization. Due to the infodemic, an increasing number of young parents are deciding not to vaccinate their children out of fear of worsening their children's health conditions, autism, and the like. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, public trust in vaccines is decreasing, which is one of the reasons for the low vaccination rates and general acceptance of all vaccines. There is a need for considerable efforts to be made to promote and preserve health, emphasize the importance of immunization, and prevent diseases. Measures to mitigate the risk and contain the spread of the disease During the epidemic, measures provided for by laws on the protection of the population from infectious diseases will be implemented. These measures include education on the prevention of infectious diseases, early detection of sources of infection and transmission routes, reporting and isolation of the sick, hospitalization and treatment, as well as enhanced immunization of children, where the Red Cross in Bosnia and Herzegovina plays a significant role.

field_reports.description:
On December 30, 2023, at 9:43 PM, an earthquake with a magnitude of 4.8 on the Richter scale struck Bosnia and Herzegovina. The location of the epicenter was near Zenica, and significant tremors were felt in the broader region of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

The earthquake caused significant damage to at least 14 residential buildings in the Zenica area. Four (4) people were injured, and two of them were hospitalized. The earthquake also caused damage to the road infrastructure, leading to a traffic accident in which one person was injured. Alongside the damages to residential buildings, the earthquake significantly affected other properties of the affected households. Media outlets have reported significant concerns among the population in the affected area, including statements that some residents whose properties were damaged or are close to the epicenter are afraid to return home, fearing further tremors.

Although the earthquake caused the most damage in the Zenica area, tremors were evidenced throughout Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Travnik, Sarajevo, and Banja Luka.

field_reports.description: In the previous period, over the past 10 days, continuous heavy rainfall has caused numerous flash floods, directly affecting over 400 households in the central, eastern, and northern parts of Bosnia and Herzegovina. More than 150 residential buildings, along with numerous auxiliary objects, have suffered significant damages in the midst of the floods, while a significant portion of agricultural land has also been heavily affected. The flash floods, persisting for 10 consecutive days, have caused damage to road infrastructure and triggered numerous landslides, directly endangering thousands of residents in the affected municipalities. In certain areas, the intensity of the flash floods was so severe that it swept away several vehicles. Due to the immediate threat to life, more than 10 households, totaling 30 individuals, had to be evacuated from their homes. The continuation of rainfall, reaching over 60 liters per square meter at certain intervals, indicates that we can expect further hazards and an increase in water levels in Bosnia and Herzegovina in the coming days.

results.summary: Due to intense precipitation in a few previous days water level of rivers in the central, north, and eastern parts of Bosnia and Herzegovina is significantly increased, causing flood waves in over 16 municipalities in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Based on the information that Red Cross Society has gathered from the field, over 100 households were directly affected by the flood wave. The constant rise of the water level in these parts of Bosnia and Herzegovina presents a threat to a few thousand inhabitants in these areas. The sudden flood wave directly endangered the lives of almost ten households, and over 20 individuals had to be displaced from their homes. Following intense precipitation and flood waves, there are many landslides, while a significant part of road communication has been damaged. This course of action is especially hard for the population of the rural part of these areas, preventing their communication and aggravating the distribution of much-needed humanitarian aid for these populations.

field_reports.description:
For the past seven days - since the 15th of May, floods have affected the northwestern part of Bosnia and Herzegovina, causing damage in 12 municipalities: Novi Grad, Prijedor, Kostajnica, Bihać, Bužim, Sanski Most, Cazin, Velika Kladuša, Ključ, Bosanska Krupa, Kozarska Dubica i Srbac. As a result of the floods, almost 900 households were directly affected, while more than 10000 people were in danger. Due to floods, 50 people were displaced, while floods caused enormous damage to the environment in this part of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

 

In the region of Prijedor and Una-Sana Canton, rivers Una and Sana, as well as smaller tributaries, due to heavy rainfall, caused massive floods. Local authorities, assisted by volunteers of the Red Cross organization, closely monitor the situation, analyzing the risk, and helping everyone in need. For the past two days - 21-21th of May, water levels were decreasing,  which indicates that the peak of the flood wave is behind us. This course of action is certainly a relief, as the new flood wave in these circumstances, will not erupt in the eastern part of Bosnia and Herzegovina, which puts out of danger more than 10000 inhabitants of the eastern part of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

 

While causing enormous damage to almost 900 households, floods caused landslides, and road damage, which are long-term dangers for inhabitants of these municipalities. In the municipality of Bosanska Krupa, more than 230 households were affected, in Bihać 200, and in Novi Grad almost 30 people were displaced, while over 160 households were damaged. Floods caused tremendous damage to crops and farms - just in Kostajnica more than 450 hectares.

 

Volunteers and staff of the Red Cross organization were constantly on the field, assisting local authorities and other actors in fighting the floods, and helping everyone in need. Some of the most needed equipment - boots and raincoats; were provided by the Red Cross organization, while volunteers distributed food and hygiene items. The Emergency Operations Center of the Red Cross Society of Bosnia and Herzegovina was constantly working on gathering information about the situation and needs of endangered people, planning and implementing the humanitarian response. Information and data collected by the Red Cross organization were used by official institutions of Bosnia and Herzegovina, which showed the true potential of the Red Cross organization in all segments of response to disasters. 

 

Red Cross organization maintained on the field even after the peak of the flood wave, gathering information about damage and needs of the affected people. Flood waves destroyed much of the healthy environment, spreading the dangers of infection and diseases. Many affected inhabitants lose their crops, farms, or other object needed for their survival, and help provided by the Red Cross organization is their only hope. In the next period, official authorities will form commissions to provide help to affected municipalities. In the meantime, the Red Cross organization remains a permanent partner and is sure to help everyone in need.

results.summary: On Monday, May 15, 2023, floods swept through the northern part of Bosnia and Herzegovina, i.e. municipalities: Novi Grad, Prijedor, Kostajnica, Bihac, Bužim, Sanski Most, Cazin, Velika Kladuša, Kluč and Bosanska Krupa. In order to respond as effectively as possible to the dangers to life and health of the population, a state of natural disaster has been declared. The effects of the floods have endangered about 400 households, and the risk of flooding threatens about 10,000 inhabitants. The National Society works on constant analysis and monitoring of the situation and needs of the endangered population, and in the coming period, following the stated needs, the National Society will adapt its activities. By the announcements, the next period i.e.  May 18, there will be intense bouts of flooding. The National Society conducts a constant exchange of information with the Country Cluster Delegation to Central & South-Eastern Europe – Nemanja Zekić (Project manager).

field_reports.description:
Oveview of situation in Bosnia and Herzegovina

Federation of BiH

On Saturday 10.12.2022. after heavy rainfall in certain places in the territory of the of Bosnia and Herzegovina, rivers overflowed, which in the afternoon and then in the evening began to cause problems for local infrastructure, facilities and citizens. Almost all cantons in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina are facing rising river levels and possible overflows. The situation in similar also in the Republic of Srpska.

Currently, the most threatened area in Federation of BiH is the Una-Sana canton, where rivers have overflowed in all municipalities and cities. Among the most critical are the municipality of Sanski Most, where a state of natural disaster has been declared, and the City of Bihać.

Immediately after realising the situation on the ground, the Red Cross of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina made contact with the Red Cross organizations in the Una-Sana Canton, and according to the Standard Operating Procedures for the Rapid Response for the Red Cross FBiH structure, the Form for initial reporting of the accident to all Red Cross cantonal organizations of the Red Cross was launched. The form was sent to the Red Cross organizations of the Tuzla, Posavina, Zenica-Doboj, Central Bosnia, West-Herzegovina and Herzegovina-Neretva cantons, as well as all municipal and city Red Cross organizations within the Red Cross of the Una-Sana canton.

The Red Cross of the Una-Sana Canton activated the Protection and Rescue Service, and in cooperation with the staff of the Red Cross of the city of Bihać, went to the field in order to assess the situation and initial needs, and distributed drinking water to the citizens. A quantity of boots and dehumidifiers have also been prepared and will be distributed tomorrow (Monday, December 12, 2022).

During the day, on 11 December 2022 at 14:00, the Red Cross of the Municipality of Sanski Most delivered the first initial information with a cross-section of the situation as follows:

  • The secretary of the Red Cross of Sanski Most municipality made contact with the headquarters of the Civil Protection 
  • Established contact with the president of local communities
  • 10 volunteers and 3 professionals were hired for field support
  • According to initial estimates, the rivers Bliha and Zdena overflowed in the narrower part of the city as well as in the surrounding towns in MZ: Gornji Kamengrad, Donji Kamengrad, Fajtovci, Vrse, Husimovci, as well as in the area of ​​Stari Majdan and Novi Naselje. The overflowing of the Željeznica and Gračanica rivers flooded between 5 and 10 households
  • About 20 households and 30 auxiliary facilities are located in the most threatened area, for which it is planned to provide food and hygiene packages.
  • Power outage and availability of potable water

Video Red Cross Sanski Most branch

https://fb.watch/hlp9T3si6F/

Links:

Teška noć u Sanskom Mostu: Izlile se dvije rijeke, grad poplavljen, oglasile se sirene za uzbunu (klix.ba)

 

Zabilježeno je vanredno hidrološko stanje na području slivova rijeka Une i Save (klix.ba)

Following the data from the Federal Civil Protection the situation is:

Una-Sana canton

City of Bihać: the water level of the Una river was 162 cm (the critical point is 100 cm), the water levels along the entire Una course are relatively high and exceed the critical points. Local communities in the area of ​​the city of Bihać reported floods in which there are dozens of flooded residential and auxiliary buildings. 

Municipality of Sanski Most: On the proposal of the Civil Protection, the municipal mayor declared a state of natural disaster. The Bliha River overflowed its banks in several places, endangering citizens and their property more and more. At one point, the concrete dam in the bed of the Bliha river broke, after which there was an uncontrolled expansion of the river flow, so that half an hour after the dam burst, two streams of the Bliha and Zdena rivers came together, and a large number of residential buildings remained under water in a short period of time . The water flooded a large number of buildings along the courses of these two rivers and in the area of ​​the local communities of Zdena, Husimovci, Vrše, Donji Kamengrad, Hatiraj, Gornji Kamnegrad, Fajtovci and Novo Naselje and Stari Majdan from the river Majdanuša. In the late evening hours, the water came into the city itself. Road communications Sanski Most - Stari Majdan, S. Most - Fajtovci in Kamengrad, Husimovci and Fajtovci and several local roads in the city are also threatened by the flood. 

City of Bosanska Krupa: A total of nine residential buildings were flooded, six houses in Bosanska Otoka, two residential buildings in the town of Svetinja, and one store in the city center. 

Municipality of Bosanski Petrovac: In the past 24 hours, the fire department had 20 technical interventions to pump out water from residential buildings. During the night, the most critical was in Donji Bišćani, Nukići and Bahići.

The city of Cazin: Yesterday, during the day, the fire department of the city of Cazin had four technical interventions to pump out water from the yard, and there were no reports of flooding during the night.

Municipality of Bužim: The situation is normalizing, the water is receding from the flooded areas, there were no reports of flooding during the night.

Municipality of Ključ: The Sanica River overflowed in a couple of places on agricultural land, there are no endangered buildings.

Municipality of Velika Kladuša: The rivers Kladušnica and Grabarska have swelled and flooded the coastal area, but there are no reports of buildings being threatened.

Zenica-Doboj canton

Rijeka Bosna is increasing (mostly in the cities: ​​Visoko, Kakanj, Zenica, Žepča, Maglaj)

Posavina Canton

The water level of the Sava River is rising along its entire course.

Tuzla canton

According to current information in the area of ​​Tuzla Canton, the water level at the HA Modrac dam at 07:00 this morning was 197.56 m.a.s.l. (with an overflow point of 200 m.a.s.l.) and is higher by 12 cm compared to the measurements 24 hours ago. The rivers in ​​Živinice and Gračanica are increasing.

West Herzegovina Canton and Herzegovina-Neretva Canton

The Trebižat River at the Humac water measuring station this morning at 8:00 a.m. was 309 cm (280 cm regular flood defense)

Central Bosnia Canton

Vrbas river in slight increase.

Republic of Srpska

Municipal Red Cross Kozarska Dubica

Due to heavy rainfall that occurred on December 10, 2022 and part of the precipitation that was repeated on December 11, 2022, there was a spill of smaller rivers as well as torrential waters that led to huge problems for some parts of the municipality of Kozarska Dubica. First, the Binjačka river poured out in the city settlement Puhalo, where 50 households were flooded, and water entered the houses of 10 households.

At the same time, small rivers Knežica and Mlječanica poured out in the village of Međuvođa, where about 30 households were flooded, and water entered 2 family houses.

In the village of Draksenić, there was a breach of the circumferential canal on the small river Rakovica, where the entire area of about 100 households was flooded, and water entered the houses and auxiliary facilities of about 20 households.

During the night of 11/12 December 2022, the water level of the river Una skyrocketed and the part of the road between Kozarska Dubica and Kostajnica was flooded, so that the water spilled over the Neighbourhood Community Komlenac and the village Vrioci. About 30 households was flooded but water did not enter residential buildings.

According to the morning information (of 12.12.2022) and the situation from the terrain, the water level of the river Una was rising until 6.00 a.m., but the situation at 9.00 a.m. is that the water level of the river Una stagnates.

Since it snowed during the night, and meteorological information predicts new precipitation, raincoats, rubber boots (large numbers), food and hygiene are necessary.

 

Municipal Red Cross Novi Grad

Heavy rainfall also affected the municipality of Novi Grad. Current status (data from Civil Protection Novi Grad):

- One big landslide in which unfortunately one person lost life,

- 150 households are threatened by flooding - flooded, water entered the basement rooms.

- 40 residential buildings flooded – water entered the ground floor or basement rooms,

- Approximately 200 facilities where water entered (Primary School "Sveti Sava" water entered it and classes in all schools were suspended),

- More than 100 flooded farmlands.

The traffic stopped on a larger number of roads in Novi Grad city.

The Headquarters for Emergency Situations has its session and was attended by the Secretary of the Municipal Red Cross Organization Novi Grad. A state of emergency has not been declared, but an emergency flood protection measure has been declared.

Current needs are for: food and hygiene packages, boots (large numbers 43-46), blankets, pumps, disinfectants, dryers, buckets, gloves, raincoats and bedding.

Municipal Red Cross Kostajnica

In the area of Kostajnica municipality due to heavy rainfall in the past three days there were flooded 7 households with accompanying facilities and 3 households - houses were flooded. The river Una spilled from the riverbed and torrential streams caused damage to the bridge in the village of Mrakodol near Kostajnica. The traffic on two routes was difficult, in the morning one road route near the village of Gornja Slabinja was closed. Damage was reported on several local and main routes. There is an active landslide in the village of Petrinja on the main road M14.

The Secretary of the Municipal Red Cross Organization Kostajnica regularly attends the meetings of the Headquarters for Emergency Situations. For the purpose of provision of assistance to the endangered population there is the need for: food parcels, hygiene, rubber boots.

City Red Cross Organization Prijedor

More than 1,000 households were flooded with large areas on which the waters spilled from heavy rainfall.

Water has entered residential buildings in over 80 households.

Water has entered auxiliary facilities in over 150 households.

The telephone session of the Headquarters for Emergency Situations in Prijedor was held and all subjects were ordered to be on standby and on duty.

There is the need of following assistance: food, hygiene, rubber boots, raincoats to be distributed to those who need it most.

 

 

City Red Cross Organization Gradiška

 

Heavy rainfall in the area of Gradiška caused a sharp increase in torrential streams and rivers in Potkozarje villages, and flooding of basement rooms of residential buildings in the area of the city settlement Senjak. There was a sharp increase in water levels and spills of the small rivers Jablanica, Vrbaška and Labina and smaller torrential streams along these rivers, water entered the courtyards of several households in the Villages of Donji Podgrdaci, Miloševo Brdo, Bistrica and Orahova (data by Civil Protection Gradiška). Water from the torrential stream in Bistrica poured into the main road Gradiška – Kozarska Dubica, but the road is passable, in one place along the road a smaller landslide was created. In the settlement Senjak, water from the sewer collector has poured into the basement rooms of residential buildings, but after a decrease in the intensity of precipitation, the water level in the collector and basements is also reduced, and firefighters are on the ground pumping water.

 

UPDATE 14/12/2022

Federation of BiH – Una Sana Canton

Red Cross of City of Bihć is still on the ground assissting the most affected area. Around 90 households are damaged totally or partially. Red Cross was providing support by boats together with the Civil Protection Unit. By now they have distributed 50 food packs, 50 hygiene packs, 50 liters of drinkable water and provided PSS for 20 persons.

Since this area is under pressure with the migration response and there are two major temporary reception centers Red Cross branch is expected to assisst flooded area, local communities but at the same time to provide daily support for migrants and refugees staying in this city.

Secretary of the Red Cross of Bosanska Krupa as part of the Emergency Civil Protection Unit participated in the needs assessment. More than 10 households are affested in the flooded area. Red Cross volunteers and staff provided Psychosocial support for 3 families and distributed 30 food packs.

Republic of Srpska

On 13 December 2022 the RCRS Disaster Preparedness and Response Coordinator  visited flooded areas in Gradiška, Prijedor, Kostajnica. Kozarska Dubica and Novi Grad. Emergency assistance was delivered by RCRS, partly on 13 December and the rest through the LRC and City RC Organizations will be distributed on 14 December 2022 to all other vulnerable households.

The aid consisted of rubber boots, disinfectants, raincoats, blankets, shovels, protective masks and food packages to the amount of over 7,500.00 BAM. The water has receded from most of the buildings and yards, although in some there is still water (please find below the link with photos specifically from Kostajnica). Moisture dehumidifiers, water pumps, cleaning kits, etc. are needed.

From today to Saturday, precipitation, rain and snow are announced again, and there is a risk of rivers spilling again.

 

UPDATE; 16/12/2022

On December 11th RCSBiH held an online meeting with the Secretaries Generals and DM coordinators together with the IFRC Cluster Office representatives to inform about the current situation and discuss about possible DREF aplication. More than 300 households are flooded. Red Cross volunteers and staff in the field are assisting governamental isntitutions and citizens. In the municipalites in the Una Sana Canton the State of natural disaster is declared. It is important to mention that this region is under high pressure when it comes to Migration response as well with two Temporary Reception Centers and many migrants and refugees in outreach areas.

There is a threat of new rain and floodings during the weekend. 

Following the information of the European Flood Awareness System there is posibility to have floodings also in Herzegovina part caused by the Neretva river.

Country(ies): Bosnia and Herzegovina
River(s): Neretva (Neretva)
Predicted start of event: Friday, 16th of December 2022 - 18:00
Earliest predicted peak: Saturday, 17th of December 2022 - 00:00
Probability to exceed a 5-year return period threshold: 75 %
Probability to exceed a 20-year return period threshold: 15 %

 

Source: EFAS - Formal Flood Information
 

New meeting with the core coordination team for DM will be held on Monday.

results.summary:
On Saturday 10.12.2022. after heavy rainfall in certain places in the territory of the of Bosnia and Herzegovina, rivers overflowed, which in the afternoon and then in the evening began to cause problems for local infrastructure, facilities and citizens. Almost all cantons in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina are facing rising river levels and possible overflows. The situation in similar also in the Republic of Srpska.

Currently, the most threatened area in Federation of BiH is the Una-Sana canton, where rivers have overflowed in all municipalities and cities. Among the most critical are the municipality of Sanski Most, where a state of natural disaster has been declared, and the City of Bihać.

Immediately after realising the situation on the ground, the Red Cross of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina made contact with the Red Cross organizations in the Una-Sana Canton, and according to the Standard Operating Procedures for the Rapid Response for the Red Cross FBiH structure, the Form for initial reporting of the accident to all Red Cross cantonal organizations of the Red Cross was launched. The form was sent to the Red Cross organizations of the Tuzla, Posavina, Zenica-Doboj, Central Bosnia, West-Herzegovina and Herzegovina-Neretva cantons, as well as all municipal and city Red Cross organizations within the Red Cross of the Una-Sana canton.

The Red Cross of the Una-Sana Canton activated the Protection and Rescue Service, and in cooperation with the staff of the Red Cross of the city of Bihać, went to the field in order to assess the situation and initial needs, and distributed drinking water to the citizens. A quantity of boots and dehumidifiers have also been prepared and will be distributed tomorrow (Monday, December 12, 2022).

During the day, on 11 December 2022 at 14:00, the Red Cross of the Municipality of Sanski Most delivered the first initial information with a cross-section of the situation as follows:

  • The secretary of the Red Cross of Sanski Most municipality made contact with the headquarters of the Civil Protection 
  • Established contact with the president of local communities
  • 10 volunteers and 3 professionals were hired for field support
  • According to initial estimates, the rivers Bliha and Zdena overflowed in the narrower part of the city as well as in the surrounding towns in MZ: Gornji Kamengrad, Donji Kamengrad, Fajtovci, Vrse, Husimovci, as well as in the area of ​​Stari Majdan and Novi Naselje. The overflowing of the Željeznica and Gračanica rivers flooded between 5 and 10 households
  • About 20 households and 30 auxiliary facilities are located in the most threatened area, for which it is planned to provide food and hygiene packages.
  • Power outage and availability of potable water

Video Red Cross Sanski Most branch

https://fb.watch/hlp9T3si6F/

Links:

Teška noć u Sanskom Mostu: Izlile se dvije rijeke, grad poplavljen, oglasile se sirene za uzbunu (klix.ba)

 

Zabilježeno je vanredno hidrološko stanje na području slivova rijeka Une i Save (klix.ba)

Following the data from the Federal Civil Protection the situation is:

Una-Sana canton

City of Bihać: the water level of the Una river was 162 cm (the critical point is 100 cm), the water levels along the entire Una course are relatively high and exceed the critical points. Local communities in the area of ​​the city of Bihać reported floods in which there are dozens of flooded residential and auxiliary buildings. 

Municipality of Sanski Most: On the proposal of the Civil Protection, the municipal mayor declared a state of natural disaster. The Bliha River overflowed its banks in several places, endangering citizens and their property more and more. At one point, the concrete dam in the bed of the Bliha river broke, after which there was an uncontrolled expansion of the river flow, so that half an hour after the dam burst, two streams of the Bliha and Zdena rivers came together, and a large number of residential buildings remained under water in a short period of time . The water flooded a large number of buildings along the courses of these two rivers and in the area of ​​the local communities of Zdena, Husimovci, Vrše, Donji Kamengrad, Hatiraj, Gornji Kamnegrad, Fajtovci and Novo Naselje and Stari Majdan from the river Majdanuša. In the late evening hours, the water came into the city itself. Road communications Sanski Most - Stari Majdan, S. Most - Fajtovci in Kamengrad, Husimovci and Fajtovci and several local roads in the city are also threatened by the flood. 

City of Bosanska Krupa: A total of nine residential buildings were flooded, six houses in Bosanska Otoka, two residential buildings in the town of Svetinja, and one store in the city center. 

Municipality of Bosanski Petrovac: In the past 24 hours, the fire department had 20 technical interventions to pump out water from residential buildings. During the night, the most critical was in Donji Bišćani, Nukići and Bahići.

The city of Cazin: Yesterday, during the day, the fire department of the city of Cazin had four technical interventions to pump out water from the yard, and there were no reports of flooding during the night.

Municipality of Bužim: The situation is normalizing, the water is receding from the flooded areas, there were no reports of flooding during the night.

Municipality of Ključ: The Sanica River overflowed in a couple of places on agricultural land, there are no endangered buildings.

Municipality of Velika Kladuša: The rivers Kladušnica and Grabarska have swelled and flooded the coastal area, but there are no reports of buildings being threatened.

Zenica-Doboj canton

Rijeka Bosna is increasing (mostly in the cities: ​​Visoko, Kakanj, Zenica, Žepča, Maglaj)

Posavina Canton

The water level of the Sava River is rising along its entire course.

Tuzla canton

According to current information in the area of ​​Tuzla Canton, the water level at the HA Modrac dam at 07:00 this morning was 197.56 m.a.s.l. (with an overflow point of 200 m.a.s.l.) and is higher by 12 cm compared to the measurements 24 hours ago. The rivers in ​​Živinice and Gračanica are increasing.

West Herzegovina Canton and Herzegovina-Neretva Canton

The Trebižat River at the Humac water measuring station this morning at 8:00 a.m. was 309 cm (280 cm regular flood defense)

Central Bosnia Canton

 

Vrbas river in slight increase.

field_reports.description:
On Friday, June 10, 2022 after heavy rain in certain places in the Federation of BiH, rivers overflowed, which in the afternoon and then in the evening began to cause problems for local infrastructure, facilities and citizens. In total 10 cities/municipalities were affected in two Cantons (Tuzla Canton & Zenica-Doboj Canton). In two municipalities (Tešanj - Zenica-Doboj Canton and Čelić - Tuzla Canton) local authorities declared a state of natural disaster. As well landslides are identified at 8 locations. 

RCSBiH is currently out of DM Coordinator and all activities are managed by the Coordinator at the RCFBiH. The most endangered area is the Municipality of Čelić in Tuzla Canton. Staff and volunteers from the Red Cross of the Municipality of Čelić and the Red Cross of Tuzla Canton are on the ground every day providing support to the local community. Also part of the Protection and Rescue Service of the Red Cross of the Federation of BiH together with the Secretary General were on the spot on Sunday, June 12, 2022 and provided support (boots, shovels, water, trolley/carts, hygiene packs and etc).

According to data from the field, about 400 houses were flooded, including the office and warehouse of the Red Cross of the municipality of Celic and is currently not operational (electronic devices were destroyed, computer, furniture, etc.). About 1,200 inhabitants are directly endangered by floods in this area.

One of the challenges faced by the citizens is the interruption in the water supply and the unavailability of drinking water, but also water to clean the facilities from sludge.

Taking into account the importance of agricultural property in the Municipality of Celic and the fact that it is a source of income and survival for most residents, the destruction of a large number of greenhouses and crops has created additional challenges but also the need for help. 

The most needed support (that can not be fully covered by local Red Cross) is in:
• providing a larger number of dehumidifiers (inquiries and needs are constant from citizens and the local community)
• material for disinfection and kits for cleaning the area from sludge (cloths, brushes, mop, buckets and etc)
• greenhouses and seed products
• cash intervention for the population
• Reconstruction and equipping of the Red Cross office of the Municipality of Čelić

field_reports.description:
During the night of April 22, at 23:07 an earthquake of 5.7 magnitude, with the epicenter 5 km deep, 42 km away from the city of Mostar and 16 km away from the town of Stolac. The earthquake was felt in the region, including the parts of Croatia, Albania, Montenegro. Population of the area reported shaking and damages both on housing objects and inside of houses. In the interval between 23:00-6:00 there were a total 12 earthquakes recorded with the magnitude between 2,7 and 5,7
After the initial earthquake, one person died and two more were injured, when a rock fell down on the family house. Another 30 people were injured with injuries such are sprains, bruises and scratches. People left their houses and many stayed out during night with fear being felt among population. 
There were damages recorded on the buildings in Mostar, Stolac, Čapljina and Ljubuski. Red Cross of Čapljina building is among the damaged buildings.  Total of 520 HHs have reported damages on their homes in Stolac and Čapljina. Also two schools are seriously damaged. Many more objects are in need of repairatio. The assessment of the local authorities is ongonig, and it would show the exact scope of the damages.  There are also damages on regional roads between these towns as a result of the earthquake

field_reports.description:
During the night of 5 November, central, eastern and southern parts of the country were hit by flash floods caused by intensive rainfall. Rivers Zeljeznica, Miljacka, Bosna and Neretva, together with smaller rivers which flow into them, flooded the area, causing damages and prompting evacuations. There are currently 18 affected municipalities in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and in the Republic of Srpska. Affected municipalities are: Ilidza, Trnovo, East Ilidza, Trnovo (FBIH), Stari Grad, Konjic, Jablanica, Novi Grad, Kiseljak, Goražde, Pale (FBIH), Pale, Foča, Sokolac, Gacko, Foča (FBIH) and Novo Sarajevo. Another 5 municipalities were less affected. Landslides are recorded in different areas around the country. Wider area of Sarajevo remained without drinking water for up to three days, making the total number of affected people around 250 00 people. 

In Ilidza, evacuation was needed at a home for elderly care, where over 58 people were evacuated to firefighting homesfire station   as a temporary solution. Livestock was evacuated as well, where possible. After the first night, they all decided to stay with family and friends, even though accommodation was offered by the Red Cross and authorities. Lower floors of an additional(?) home for elderly care were flooded, prompting evacuation of the residents to the upper floors. 55 residents of the home for elderly care eventually need to be accommodated, since accommodation in the affected facility is no longer possible. Since then, residents were re-allocated to other care home or family members. Residents were in need of Mental Health and Psychosocial Support (MHPSS). People, who were evacuated to the firefighting home, are now staying at family members or at other locations. 106 housing buildings were flooded or damaged. The actions made in coordination of different actors, in activities to mitigate risks, have given results and no further damages were made. A total of 192 HHs were directly affected. 

In Novi Grad, 80 people were evacuated from housing and industrial objects. 22 housing buildings are damaged. The only company that produces medical oxygen in the country is located in this municipality and their facility was in danger with the rising waters, prompting evacuation of parts of equipment and staff to a different location. After the initial flooding, on the second day, water levels have been decreasing. A total number of directly affected HHs is 71.

In Municipality Trnovo (FBIH), 20 housing buildings are damaged, together with many roads. In Vogošća municipality 20 housing objects were damaged. 

Image 4. Flooded houses in Trnovo, Red Cross of Republic of Srpsk photo: RCSBiH  

In Trnovo, 118 housing buildings were damaged. The livelihoods of people are damaged or destroyed, since the agricultural land is flooded, and more than 100 livestock drowned during the flooding of the river Zeljeznica. During the weekend   of 6-7 November, flooding brought much material with the water, which decreases the capacity of the riverbed to take additional quantities of water, increasing the risk of further damages. Eventually, the situation resolved with minimum additional damages. In the immediate aftermath of the rainfall, landslides started which initiated further Image 4. Flooded houses in Trnovo, Red Cross of Republic of Srpsk photo: RCSBiH   initiated further damage to housing objects. Livelihoods are also damaged. 


In Konjic, 20 residences of a Hotovlje local community were evacuated to the local mosque, and there are no available roads to approach them. This blockage is caused by heavy landslides, which started as a result of the rainfall. Civil protection teams are working on the field to find a solution trying to fix the connecting roads, while going on foot to provide assistance to the population. A power generator was delivered to the village, so the residents have electricity until the road is fixed. Most of the population is elderly. Many housing objects around the municipality are damaged. Another 5 housing objects are damaged by the landslides. 

In Jablanica, Gacko and Foča, landslides started as a result of rainfall, also damaging the livelihoods. In these municipalities, a total of 19 HHs were directly affected. Damages to livelihoods were recorded in Pale municipality, due to landslides and flash floods. A total of 180 HHs were directly affected.  In Sokolac, the storm weather created damages to 6 HHs. In the municipality of Stari Grad in Sarajevo, there was no drinking water for two days straight, while electricity blackouts were recorded in several municipalities.                                                                                         


In other municipalities, damages on the infrastructure were recorded. 
In most areas, population and authorities are calling for support in the form of equipment for cleaning the housing objects. 

The HQs of the Red Cross Society of BiH suffered damage from the intensive rainfall. The damage was amplified since the incident happened while renovation works were ongoing. The HQs space is still not available for work on a permanent basis. Red Cross of Federation of BiH HQs stayed without electricity, forcing the DM team to work at a displaced location. 

On November 5, the state of emergency had been declared in Republic of Srpska and in municipalities of Ilidza, Novi Grad, Konjic, Zivinice, Vogosca, Trnovo (FBIH) in Federation of BiH.
